intro: Muehlenbeckia hastulata var. hastulata, commonly known as the common muehlenbeckia, is a species of flowering plant in the goodeniaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in spring and summer. It is native to South America and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
